details.title: Ahead of trust vote, BS Yediyurappa offers players at Bengaluru's Sri Bala Vera Anjaneya temple
details.content:
Karnataka CM, BS Yediyurappa offers prayers at Bengaluru's Sri Bala Vera Anjaneya temple; his government to prove majority in Karnataka Assembly today. pic.twitter.com/iCfxLuEL9Q

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2019

details.title: BJP at pains to explain age exception for 76-year-old Yediyurappa
details.content:
Yeddyurappa, 76, is the only exception within the BJP who has become the chief minister of Karnataka despite the age bar. he age bar within the party, however, had brought political careers of a host of BJP leaders to an end, which included veterans like L K Advani, Murali Manohar Joshi, Sumitra Mahajan, Karia Munda, Shanta Kumar, B C Khanduri, B C Koshiari and Hukum Dev Narayan Yadav, who couldn’t contest the Lok Sabha polls.

(READ MORE HERE)

details.title: 14 Karnataka MLAs to challenge their disqualification in Supreme Court
details.content: All the 14 Karnataka rebel legislators, who were disqualified by Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar on Sunday for defying their party whips to attend the House on July 23, said they would challenge the Speaker's decision in the Supreme Court on Monday.

details.title: Five disqualified Congress MLAs return to Mumbai
details.content:
#Karnataka: Five disqualified Congress MLAs including Byrathi Basavaraj, MTB Nagaraj, ST Somashekhar return to Bengaluru from Mumbai. pic.twitter.com/F22sWZuoMX

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2019

details.title: In defeat, Kumaraswamy seeks a hero’s halo
details.content:
From a self-proclaimed ‘helpless’ chief minister limited by the compulsions of the coalition, HD Kumaraswamy seemed to have come a long way to deliver a fiery speech on Tuesday. In his last few hours as Chief Minister, Kumaraswamy may have asserted his leadership and achievements far more effectively than he ever did in the past 14 months.

(READ MORE HERE)

details.title: Yediyurappa arrives at Vidhana Soudha
details.content:
Karnataka: The newly sworn-in Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa arrives at Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru. He will face a trust vote today. pic.twitter.com/5g7hfKFybE

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2019

details.title: Congress legislative party meeting underway
details.content: Congress legislative party (CLP) meeting begins at Vidhana soudha. CLP leader Siddaramaiah, Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee President Dinesh Gundu Rao, KJ George, Priyank Kharge, MB Patil, Eshwar Khandre and and other Congress MLAs are present. (ANI)

details.title: Why is BJP concerned over the disqualification of Congress-JD(S) defector-MLAs? asks Siddaramaiah
details.content:
ಕಾಂಗ್ರೆಸ್ ಮತ್ತು ಜೆಡಿಎಸ್ ಪಕ್ಷಗಳ ಪಕ್ಷಾಂತರಿ ಶಾಸಕರನ್ನು ವಿಧಾನಸಭಾ ಅಧ್ಯಕ್ಷರು ಅನರ್ಹಗೊಳಿಸಿದರೆ
ಬಿಜೆಪಿ ನಾಯಕರು ಹೊಟ್ಟೆ ಉರ್ಕೊಳ್ಳೋದು ಯಾಕೆ? ಅವರ ಮೇಲೆ ಈ ಪರಿಯ ಕಾಳಜಿ ಯಾಕೆ?
ಅವರೇನು ಇವರ ಪಕ್ಷದ ಶಾಸಕರೇ?#disqualifiedMLAs@INCKarnataka

— Siddaramaiah (@siddaramaiah) July 29, 2019

details.title: Congress legislative party meet over, trust vote soon
details.content: The Congress legislative party (CLP) meeting, at Vidhana Soudha, has now concluded. #Karnataka

details.title: Disqualified MLAs move SC challenging Speaker Ramesh Kumar
details.content: The disqualified Karnataka MLAs Ramesh Jarkhiholi and Mahesh Kumathalli moved the Supreme Court to challenge their disqualification under the anti defection law.

details.title: Assembly session begins
Siddaramaiah says Congress doesn't have a problem with trust vote
details.content: Siddaramaiah says Congress doesn't have a problem with the motion of confidence and BJP can discuss it if it likes. Speaker allows CM to make a short 5-minute speech.

details.title: Yediyaruppa begins speech by invoking goddess Chamundeshwari.
details.content: No vindictive politics in the previous regimes. The administration collapsed and we assure to set it right. I assure that BJP won't indulge in vindictive politics either. I believe in forget and forgive: Yediyaruppa

details.title: 'I've decided to give 2 installments of Rs 2000 to beneficiaries under PM Kisan scheme from state's side'
details.content:
K'taka CM: There is drought. I want to address farmers' issues. I've decided to give 2 installments of Rs 2000 to beneficiaries under PM Kisan scheme from state's side. I appeal to opposition that we must work together. I appeal to House to unanimously express confidence in me. pic.twitter.com/TJYt0kbd5m

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2019

details.title: 'Don't want to speak on Kumaraswamy 's confidence motion again'
details.content: Siddaramaiah: Kumaraswamy's confidence motion was discussed for more than 4 days. I spoke on it too and I don't want to talk about it again.

details.title: 'Not obliged to answer Yediyurappa'
details.content:
HD Kumaraswamy, JD(S) in Vidhana Soudha: I ran govt for 14 months. I have no obligation to answer your (BS Yediyurappa) questions. I need to answer to my conscience. From past 14 months, everything was being recorded. People know what work I have done. #Karnataka pic.twitter.com/jeTOb9xuqR

— ANI (@ANI) July 29, 2019

details.title: Big win for BJP in Karnataka
details.content: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa wins trust vote through voice vote.

details.title: Finance bill passed
details.content: Karnataka Assembly passes Finance Bill through voice vote.

details.title: Speaker KR Ramesh Kumar tenders his resignation
details.content: Karnataka legislative assembly speaker KR Ramesh Kumar tenders his resignation from the post.

details.title: 'Wasn't under pressure while ruling under X schedule'
details.content: Speaker: I will try to stay true to all the honour you have shown me. I have neither pressurised nor been under pressure while ruling under X schedule ( of the Constitution). The X schedule needs a relook.

details.title: 'Don't be under the illusion that they are your real well wishers'
details.content: "I stand by what I once said of Yediyurappa. As power comes, people come and hang around you. Don't be under the illusion that they are your real well wishers": Speaker

details.title: This govt is nothing but unconstitutional & immoral: Siddaramaiah
details.content:
.@BSYBJP will not be able to complete full term as they are dependent on those who have lost all morals.

This govt is nothing but unconstitutional & immoral. When @BSYBJP took the oath, half way mark was 111 but how on Earth did they show numbers to the governor.

— Siddaramaiah (@siddaramaiah) July 29, 2019
The Assembly has been adjourned till 5 PM.
